events.description: The benchmark KOSPI rose 0.8% to around 5,330 on Wednesday, extending gains near record highs.
Tuesday’s violent selloff-and-rebound in the South Korean market.

facts.fact_text: The KOSPI index rose 0.8% to approximately 5,330 on Wednesday.

evidences.evidence_text: The benchmark KOSPI rose 0.8% to around 5,330 on Wednesday, extending gains near record highs

facts.fact_text: Hyundai Motor, LG Energy Solution, SK Square, and Doosan Enerbility shares increased while Samsung Electronics and SK Hynix decreased.

evidences.evidence_text: Hyundai Motor (2.8%), LG Energy Solution (2.3%), SK Square (2.9%), and Doosan Enerbility (4.3%) advanced, while Samsung Electronics and SK Hynix fell more than 1% each.

facts.fact_text: There was heavy institutional and foreign buying in the previous trading session.

evidences.evidence_text: following heavy institutional and foreign buying in the previous session.

claims.claim_text: Bargain hunting and sector rotation are supporting market sentiment.

evidences.evidence_text: as continued bargain hunting and sector rotation supported sentiment.

claims.claim_text: AI-related pressure is causing concerns for global tech shares.

evidences.evidence_text: amid lingering concerns over AI-related pressure on global tech shares.

claims.claim_text: The current market performance indicates sector rotation rather than a broad move away from risk.

evidences.evidence_text: The more balanced sector performance suggested rotation rather than a broad risk-off move

evidence.evidence_text: amid lingering concerns over AI-related pressure on global tech shares.
The more balanced sector performance suggested rotation rather than a broad risk-off move
Investors continued to focus on domestic momentum following heavy institutional and foreign buying in the previous session.
